entry.summary:
There is more to life than increasing its speed.
Mahatma Gandhi
ç”Ÿæ´»ä¸ä»…ä»…æ˜¯è¿½æ±‚é€Ÿåº¦çš„æå‡ã€‚
The more I worked, the less I exercised, read fiction, saw friends, went for long and meandering walks, cookedâ€”the things that made me feel like a well-rounded person. The other bits of my life fell away, and the more I worked, the more I felt invested in work: the more I needed work to go well in order to feel good about myself. But over time, I felt less like myself, less effective at work, and powerless to do anything about the onslaught of assignments being thrown my way.
One way to help mitigate this is to maintain boundaries with your definitions (you areÂ not Â your job) and your time (recharging is not a luxury). Itâ€™s to work on your self-care.
I keep mâ€¦
